author: Ryan Hatch | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Matt Harvey's agent, Scott Broas, takes out insurance policy on Mets righty, report says
text:
Mets ' right-handed pitcher Matt Harvey, entangled in an innings-limit controversy towards the end of this season, has had an insurance policy taken out on his right arm by his agent, Scott Boras.
CBS Sports' Jon Heyman wrote Monday morning that the exact value of the insurance policy is unknown, that it's a "fraction" of what Harvey would likely command on the open market as a free agent in a few years, but still one in place in case something happens to Harvey's surgically repaired right elbow.
"The insurance is a two-tiered type, with a certain payout if there's a loss of earnings based on a slippage of performance, and a different payout if his promising career ends early," writes Heyman of the policy that was purchased at the end of the 2015 regular season.
Harvey has thrown 202 innings this season after missing all of 2014 because of Tommy John surgery after the '13 season. Towards the end of September this season, when Harvey's innings were reaching 180 for the year , Boras and Harvey publicly said they were reaching the limit, at least for the year.
Harvey began throwing shorter outings and was skipped in the rotation as a result, a move that appeared to alienate the Mets franchise and fans.
